wiki.content: "Abracadabra" is the third single from Lady Gaga's seventh studio album, MAYHEM. The track blends electronic and house influences with pulsating beats, hypnotic synths, and dramatic vocals, reminiscent of her The Fame Monster and Chromatica eras. It also incorporates a melody from Siouxsie and the Banshees' "Spellbound". Premiered at the 67th Annual Grammy Awards, the song has been praised for its dark, theatrical style and energetic production. Critics highlighted its intense, catchy chorus, Europop-inspired climax, and Gaga's powerful vocal performance. It achieved 4.92 million Spotify streams on its first day, marking her biggest solo debut on the platform. The music video, co-directed by Gaga, Parris Goebel, and Bethany Vargas, features a dramatic dance battle between two versions of Gaga—one in red latex, representing control, and the other in white, symbolizing chaos. The choreography reflects themes of duality, resilience, and the struggle between light and darkness. Critics compared its aesthetics to "Bad Romance" and praised its high-fashion visuals and dynamic energy. Read more on Last.fm.
